data.text: @Stuhutton1 @statsjamie Another point to hear in mind is that Daily Expose is a fake news/conspiracy theory website. You just have to take a look at the garbage they post to realise that they have no credibility at all on anything.
@KarlHawkins76 @statsjamie I don't know and neither do I care but your community transmission comment was nonsense
@KarlHawkins76 @statsjamie It's a staff problem, has been from the start
@82LeeG @statsjamie Staff, and to a lesser extent visitors,  get exposed to the virus in the community and take it inside hospitals where they have contact with patients. Simple, really.
@KarlHawkins76 @statsjamie How do you work that one out
@statsjamie Inevitable with such high numbers of community transmission.
@statsjamie ..or are they still testing at a Ct of 45?!!

@statsjamie What is the point in this graph? “Definitely” and “probably” are two very different things. Which is it? There could be 3 people who “definitely” caught it in hospital, the rest could have entered hospital infected. You’re a very slimy character. https://t.co/Nx76ACPvCC
